description: open tower form; square base with 3 goats; drunken man holding goblet and bottle at bottom; first tier has floriform center and 4 children holding candles and groggers or pennants, standing on an openwork railing with birds; children's heads support second tier, with bird railing and 4 turned stems with flower heads, held together with a ring; braided blue candle included
markings: backside of base, stamped: [HANDMADE/ BY M. ENDE/ ISRAEL/ (lion) ME/ SILVER (sack)]
text: The ceremony to end Shabbat (the Sabbath) is called Havdalah, which means "separation" and takes place just after dark on Saturday evening.  The ceremony begins with pouring a cup of wine and lighting a special candle with four wicks braided together.  Special stands such as this one hold the candle in place during the ceremony.
title: Havdalah (separation) candle stand
